data.title: Is there really no where else to eat?
data.text: My husband and I and our little dog were in Raleigh,NC for business in August. We thought we would try Tasty 8's for lunch. The outside window was fun ordering but we waited a long time for our food. I guess the server thought we were thirsting to death outside waiting so she brought out our drink. The lemonade / sweet tea was good. The food arrived and we rejoiced. We both had a hotdog with mustard, chili and slaw and my husband then asked for ketchup also. I ordered a plain weinee (no bread) for my dog. My hotdog was burned and tough but the worst part was the chili. It had beans in it and had a strange aftertaste. Also, there was no indication which hotdog had the ketchup on it so, of course, I ended up with it. I really couldn't taste the ketchup though, the burned meat and chili were quite overpowering. My husband's hotdog was also burned but he thought the chili was okay kind of. My dog loved the weiner--go figure. I could see it was burned as I fed it to her. Anyway the best part was how pricey it was!  Two hotdogs and a weiner with one small drink was $19.65.  I thought that was high but if the food had been good, I wouldn't have minded. I will not eat there again.

data.title: Many hot dogs
data.text: You order at the counter and they call you when your order is ready.  There are 8 choices of hot dogs with different toppings. The ones we had were good.

data.title: Very Good...2 out of 2
data.text: I got the BLT hotog and my friend got the Southern Comfort hotdog.  I wish I had gotten fries as well, but needless to say they both were great.  The hotdog itself is top notch.  Never tasted one like this before and I'm not a fan of blue cheese but on the southern comfort it fit.  It wasn't too overpowering!  I will be back!  Nice place!

data.title: Tasty Indeed!
data.text: Tasty 8 's is the perfect hot dog fix. We visited during a very busy Saturday afternoon- lines moved quickly and orders were hot and delicious! On this visit, I ordered the El Perro Dog - a jalapeño brat smothered in queso fresco and Mexican crema. Top secret tip - order the Belgian style frites - they are hand cut in house vs. the sweet potato fries. We will be back!

data.title: Hot dogs and cold beer
data.text:
This is the best hotdog place I've been to. They have unique hotdog options and a great rotating local beer selection. A little pricey but totally worth trying.
P.S. The chow chow is excellent!!

data.title: If you like hot dogs, you'll love Tasty Eights
data.text: Food here is served Counter style.  Order at the register and they'll call you when it's done.  Sometimes you'll get a really great staff member who will bring food out to you.  When it's not too busy this place is a real treat.  It's a slam dunk for our out of town guests to get a good casual meal in downtown Raleigh that isn't more of the same old, same old.  They have Specials on the Stealz app.  All the hot dogs are good, they always have a special Dog (try the chimmichuri if they have it).  My go to is the Chicago Dog...it's perfect.  They also have killer shakes and a solid draft list.

data.title: Hot dogs and milkshakes
data.text:
The hot dogs were pricey ($7), but very good with generous toppings.  The milkshakes ($5) were excellent.  Fries ($3) were very good too.  

Service was prompt and friendly.

data.title: Cana hot dog be a treat?  Yes it can
data.text:
We popped in last weekend while meandering the varied offerings of downtown Raleigh. We'd seen Tasty 8s previously and decided to swing in. 
I've never been one for specialty hot dogs; give me a Sabrett from a filthy cart outside Madison Square Garden and I'll be very happy. 
These were very tasty; a tad pricey but the kids enjoyed it.
We had one Chicago, a BLT, a Mexican sort of thing and a special (topped with Mac and cheese).
The fries were good; not great...could have been crispier. 
But, the dogs/brats were very tasty and it was a good lunch.  
The space is kinda small and it got crowded as soon as we ordered; we were happy to get a table.

data.title: Interesting hot dogs but not a fan
data.text:
Visited early on a rainy lunchtime and the place was deserted.  Selected the Southern Comfort dog with sweet potato fries.  You can select from among 8 sauces for your fries.  I tried the blue cheese which tasted like you would think but the little cup was only half full and clumps were stuck on the bottom.  The dog itself was nicely prepared- sliced in half and grilled.  The coleslaw and scallions tasted fresh and good but the chili had beans in it which is not how we do it in the South.  With a name like Southern Comfort, I thought they'd know that.  The fries were kind of waffle fries- quite thin and crispy which is exactly how I don't like them.  

I like how they've remodeled the restaurant.  It has a good vibe with its wood, chalkboards, and big glass garage style doors that are open on nice days.  The layout is pretty convenient for ordering and for seating.  The staff was friendly and service was fast.  

Neither I nor my friend were interested in returning.  He got French fries and he didn't finish his either.

data.title: Tasty hot dogs in downtown Raleigh
data.text: This place has indoor counter service and an outdoor window. The long line by the window caught my eye and and a local in line vouched for the place, so I decided to hop in line. There was an interesting variety of hot dogs, and I tried the Chicago style dog, which had fresh toppings and was very tasty! Service was friendly and quick. Great place for a casual lunch if you are on the go in downtown Raleigh.

data.title: Expensive Dog
data.text: I had heard of this place offering interesting toppings on hot dogs. Wife and I went downtown to experience the hype. The menu choices are great. Upon receiving our order disappointment set in. Could not believe we paid $8 for each dog and it did not appear to be any larger of beef dog than one I could fix at home. There was more bun than beef. The ingredients were ok. We both thought the product received was way over priced. The restaurant atmosphere is nothing to write home about.

data.title: Great Gourmet Dogs
data.text: What a gem! The hot dogs and buns are just crazy tasty in this buzzy busy hot dog chain with a plethora of topping choices. It's really the quality of the dogs and buns that shine through. It's a tough wait around lunch but totally worth it. Yum, yum. My favorite commercial hot dog joint.

data.title: Just a Schmancy Average Hot Dog
data.text: The actual meat cylinder at the heart of it all is just an average hot dog....and the split-roast technique is rather snarky way to boost flavor notes.  When you pile on a bunch of snappy-sounding ingredients and call it gourmet, is it really anything special?  Not when the "steak" on the Yo Adrian is dry and tasteless. Not when the salsa and guac on the El Perro are sub-standard drizzles.  First, supply a well-cooked great meat tube, then add fresh and high-quality toppings and you've got yourself a winning hot dog.  I can do this at home for about $1.50 per dog and save $5 apiece versus this trendy but inadequate pretender doghouse.  Have a Sabrett's instead and save the hassle and cash.

data.title: Good Fries but the Veggie Dog needs work!
data.text: This place has some of the best sweet potato fries you will ever eat! They offer a range of really good dips to try also. I would like to see them switch veggie dog vendors because the current ones are just not that good. The falafel dog is outstanding however!!! Their prices are reasonable though with a $8-9 lunch combo. Very nice staff and clean on the inside.

data.title: Fun atmosphere.  Great location.  Different.
data.text:
Tasty 8s is in walking distance to the Science Museum in Downtown Raleigh.  The restauarnt is very small with limited seating.  We ate outside.  More tables are needed and umbrellas would be great for hot days.  There are also 2 picnic tables. 
We ate at Tasty 8s on a Saturday afternoon and we were fortunate the weather was great.  We were able to put together multiple tables and we moved them into the shade of a tree.  
The hotdogs were tasty.  My hotdog had pimento cheese and it was tasty.  One person in our party had the falafel hot dog and was very complementary.  The best food was the french fries and the chocolate milk shake.  For a hot dog, soft drink and fries plan to spend around $10.00.

data.title: Love The Idea...Only Like The Place a Little
data.text:
Ate here on a Saturday. Yo Adrienne and BLT Dog with reg Fries and Sweet Pot Fries. The dogs were grilled and pretty tasty. The additions were decent and fun. Nothing wrong at all with any of it, including very good fries and Sweet Pot fries. I really wanted to love this place, but I only like it. Some of the other dog places in the area are better. Wasn't impressed with the drink area or really any of the employee attention to customers. Would have told a manager about what we saw but no one seemed to be one or care. They were not that busy but need to pay attention and ask how things are going. 

By the way, the tables were filthy but no one working there seemed to care. Go to Snoopy's or The Roast Grill or even Char Grill for better. 

Tasty 8s - wake up and live up to what you could be!

data.title: Should have gone to the Hot Dog Cart outside
data.text: This place is the most overrated hot dog Ever. Reading other reviews no way is this worth the price it will cost you $10 before you get out the door. If you get out the door.  I waited in line for more than 20 minutes 5 people ahead of me and a line out the door. The staff was obviously incompetent and doesn't know how to run a register or able to break a $20 bill. Cm on all the prices are the same... open a second register... seat people then take their order...don't make them  wait in line... try not to look like a fast food joint... You're not gonna make it long running like you are now! !!

data.title: Great fries
data.text: Falafel dog was just okay, but the fries and sauce were great. Some nice outdoor seating and good atmosphere inside. The shakes looked really delicious, so will try next time. Be prepared to wait in line.

data.title: Good Dogs
data.text: The children love to come in for their kids meal corn dogs. They are very good with a crispy beer batter type breading. The french fries are good, and they offer applesauce or yogurt as healthy alternative sides. Unfortunatily, the kids meal drink options are just the typical fountain offerings. For a quick meal like this downtown, Tasty Eights is a very good option.

data.title: Good Dogs
data.text: Had lunch on a recent Sat.  Weather was terrible so it was not crowded.  Had a Yo Adrian (Dog, peppers/onions/cheese) and it was very good.  Loved the home made fries and dipping sauce.  Seemed like a pretty good deal for dog, fries and drink for 8.88. Had beer and shakes but did not try them.
